RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 1 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 12200. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 16 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 16 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MIRACLE DRUG (IRE) threw her head and hopped at the start, stalked the early pace four wide, rallied three wide through the turn to make the lead in upper stretch then finished full of run to win going away under a strong hand ride. O K BABY dueled for the lead two wide then along the inside into the stretch and was no match for the winner. V K STAR trailed through the turn, swung wide and closed gap late near mid track. HERO'S DAUGHTER went evenly. VOODOOISM failed to menace. FREE TO RUN contested the lead along the inside into the turn, had speed into the stretch then faded. AWESOME WONDER battled for the lead three then two wide into the stretch and was used up.

ENTRY.NAME: O K Baby
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled, 2 wide, inside, no match for winner,

ENTRY.NAME: Miracle Drug (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: threw head, hopped start, rallied 3 wide, full of run, going away

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 2 1M Dirt CR: 84. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 25600. FOR REGISTERED OHIO FOALS THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $8,000 OR LESS IN 2022 - 2023 OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April16 Allow ed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since March 16 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VISUAL MISSION well placed, rallied rallied three wide into the stretch, made the lead at the furlong marker and drew off to win as much the best under left handed urging. GOLD N SILVER set the pace along the rail through the clubhouse turn, gave up the advantage, shifted out two wide before a half, came on again on the far turn, battled into the stretch then was no match for the winner while well clear for second. NEBULOSA chased the pace around the first turn, made the lead and quickly drew clear after a quarter, set the pace into the stretch, drifted out late and. PRIVATE DRIVE stalked the pace along the inside and lacked the needed response. SAMMY DA BULL was no factor. HANSENATION was no threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Gold N Silver
ENTRY.COMMENT: early pace inside, dropped back, came again 2 wide, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Visual Mission
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, rallied 3 wide, 1/8pole lead, drew off,

ENTRY.NAME: Sammy Da Bull
ENTRY.OWNER: R and P Racing Stables, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Nebulosa
ENTRY.COMMENT: quick move 2 wide backstretch, clear lead, weakened late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 49. Claiming Purse 17400. FOR REGISTERED OHIO FOALS FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 16 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 16 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $7,5 00.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COSTUME JEWELRY allowed to settle, closed willingly four wide through the turn, made the lead before the furlong marker and drew clear under an energetic hand ride. BUSYBEING FABULOUS broke in front, set the pace to the quarter pole and finished second best. STARLITESLEW pressed the pace along the inside into the turn, put a head in front then was outfinished. SHANGHAI ROYALTY close up, went evenly. BIRDIE'S CHANTZ was bumped at the start, saved ground and turned in an even effort. PATTI LOU failed to menace. SEEKING THE MONEY pressed the pace three wide for a half then faded. WELLOILEDCAT broke inward bumping BIRDIE'S CHANTZ at the start and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Costume Jewelry
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, closed willingly, 4 wide, drew off, hand ride

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Blazing Meadows Farm LLC & WinStarFarm, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Busybeing Fabulous
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, set pace 1/4 pole, second best,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 4 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 83. Allowance Purse 29700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since March 16 Allowed 4 lbs. (Claiming Races For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ALFIO chased the pace through the clubhouse turn, assumed command before a half, set the balance of the pace and widened through the stretch to win as much the best under a strong hand ride. R CARDINAL PRINCE chased the pace and finished second best in the five path. AGNELLO'S DREAM well placed along the inside, went evenly. BOSS BEAR unhurried, swung wide and passed tiring rivals on the far turn. ONEMORANDTHECHECK settled four wide then failed to menace. SEE SPOT RUN set the pace along the rail around the first turn then was through after a half. HAD RIGHT trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Alfio
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased early, took charge backstretch, drew off, much the best,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 5 1M Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 12200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE NOVEMBER 16. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NOBLE BEHAVIOR broke in front, set all the pace, drifted out to the ten path through deep stretch and lasted under strong handling. GEH SCHNELL slow early, swung wide, closed fast in the middle of the racetrack and got up for second. RIDING IN THE WIND altered course six wide on the backstretch and rallied determinedly in the eleven path through the stretch. KING ANDRES stalked the pace in an even effort. GALTERO vied for the lead while saving ground near the inside and was outfinished. DUEL FUEL forwardly place from the start, loomed boldly three wide on the far turn then leveled off. ALGORIX wide early, loomed boldly two wide into the far turn, had speed into the stretch then came up empty. AULD LANGE SYNE close up along the inside weakened in the stretch. GUCCISSIMO showed little, pulled up injured past the wire and was walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Geh Schnell
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, swung wide, closed fast mid track, up place

ENTRY.NAME: Noble Behavior
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led throughout, drifted 10path, lasted

ENTRY.NAME: King Andres
ENTRY.OWNER: R and P Racing Stables, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Riding in the Wind
ENTRY.COMMENT: altered course 6 wide backstretch, gaining late 11path

ENTRY.NAME: Algorix
ENTRY.COMMENT: wide early, loomed boldly 2 wide 2nd turn, empty,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 94. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 21700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $8,000 OR LESS IN 2022 - 2023 OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 16 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 16 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Claiming Races For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FAT DADDY vied for the lead along the rail, got through at the top of the stretch, took charge near the three sixteenths pole and edged clear late under mild left handed urging. DYRDEK stalked the early pace, loomed boldly three wide nearing the quarter pole and finished second best four wide. TRAGICALLY QUEWICK pressed the pace two then three wide into the stretch and was outfinished. BOURBON WISDOM never far back, finished with good courage five wide. LAZARUS PROJECT saved ground and went evenly. AMIGO'S AFFAIR away alertly, set the pace into the stretch, drifted to the three path and weakened late. RIVERBOAT GAMBLER had speed into the turn then faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Fat Daddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead, inside, got through, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Amigo's Affair
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace upper stretch, drifted, 3path, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Bourbon Wisdom
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, finished well, 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Lazarus Project
ENTRY.OWNER: Lion Palm Racing Stable and Sixth Gear LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Dyrdek
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, loomed boldly 3 wide 1/4 pole, second best,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 71. Allowance Purse 35800. FOR REGISTERED OHIO FOALS THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OPTIONAL, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 16 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 16 Allowed 4 lbs. (Claiming Races For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RAISE THE PURSES never far back, swung wide, closed willingly in the middle of the racetrack under left then right handed urging and got up in time. KID RUSSELL pressed the pace three then two wide, made the lead midway on the turn, shook clear in upper stretch, drifted to the six path then couldn't handle the winner. G T THREE FIFTY stalked the pace two wide and finished with good courage in the four path. TURNING PAGES pressed the early pace along the inside and was outfinished in the three path. A PRAYER FOR KIDS failed to menace. MUCHO PRIMO was bumped at the start, sprinted to the lead two wide, set the pace into the turn then weakened. RED COMET bore in bumping MUCHO PRIMO at the start and was no threat. SWEET JILL'S JACK was outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Mucho Primo
ENTRY.OWNER: Poe Racing Stable LLC and 8 and 3 Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, rushed to lead, set pace mid turn, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Red Comet
ENTRY.COMMENT: bore in, bumped start, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Raise the Purses
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, swung wide, closed willingly mid track, in time

ENTRY.NAME: Kid Russell
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 3-2wide, led, edged clear, drifted 6path, caught

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 76. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26400. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CYCLONE prompted the pace two wide into the turn, made the lead at the quarter pole, matched strides until deep stretch then drew off under mild right handed urging. CHARTED away alertly, set the pace along the inside to the quarter pole, dug in gamely dueling until deep stretch then was no match for the winner. C C'S CLEAR CREEK had good early speed then faded. MOBOT trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Charted
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace 1/4 pole, no match for winner,

ENTRY.NAME: Cyclone
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 2 wide, assumed command 1/4 pole, drew off,
